definition: to put one's hand to sth/to set about/skillful hands/worker/writer

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: All voting systems are open to tampering and error.
sentences.chinese: 所有的投票系统都能被人做手脚或出错。

sentences.english: And if the condition gets worse, is it operable?
sentences.chinese: 如果情况更糟，那还能做手术吗？

sentences.english: Need not medicaments and become an operation, the good method that treats rhinitis is there?
sentences.chinese: 不用药物和做手术，有什么好的治疗鼻炎的好方法吗？

sentences.english: Dr Goh recalled the dilemma he faced before carrying out the operation.
sentences.chinese: 高医生回想起做手术前所面对的两难。

sentences.english: Surgical removal of a breast cyst is necessary only in a few unusual circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 只有在不得已的情况下才有必要做手术移除乳腺囊肿。

sentences.english: Norman, a cardiac patient, is waiting for surgery.
sentences.chinese: 诺曼是心脏病患者，正等着做手术。

sentences.english: We rushed her to the hospital where she underwent surgery and now she is in a stable condition.
sentences.chinese: 我们马上将她送到医院做手术，现在她情况稳定。

sentences.english: I have doubts about the advisability of surgery in this case.
sentences.chinese: 关于该病例做手术的可行性，我持有疑问。

sentences.english: One of these was pain, operations had to be done without anaesthetics .
sentences.chinese: 一个原因是疼痛，做手术没有麻醉剂。

sentences.english: The young nurse was assisting at her first operation.
sentences.chinese: 这个年轻女护士参加第一次做手术。

sentences.english: The very last set of options would be surgery.
sentences.chinese: 最后一套治疗方案就是做手术。

sentences.english: They could not do surgery, nor could they do a liver tra lant for him.
sentences.chinese: 他既不能做手术，又不能进行肝脏移植。

sentences.english: He signed to me to be quiet.
He has a habit of gesticulating while he speaks.
Lelisa is Oromo and made the sign in support of Oromo protests.
sentences.chinese: 勒利萨是奥罗莫人，做手势旨在支持奥罗莫抗议。

sentences.english: They could not do surgery， nor could they do a liver transplant for him.
sentences.chinese: 他既不能做手术，又不能进行肝脏移植。

definition: to chop up (meat etc)/to chop off (sb's hand etc)
to cure by drying over a fire (tea, meat etc)/to bake
to work as spy/to act as a guide
pilaf (rice dish popular in many parts of the world, including Xinjiang)/pilau
to arrange/to handle/to cook/cuisine/art of cooking
